backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining the backend for AI SkillBridge, managing session-based mentor response storage, merge conflict records, and industry challenges (CRUD) using in-memory maps.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping each product feature (dashboard, data structure visualizer, AI mentor panel, git conflict simulator, etc.) to their implementing frontend files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON file containing short summaries of two frontend pages: ChallengeWorkspace (challenge fetch/answer editor) and MyNotes (localStorage-backed AI mentor response history).
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining CSS custom properties for light and dark theme tokens (colors, radius, chart colors, sidebar) used throughout the app.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell for the React SPA titled 'AI SkillBridge', mounting the app at the #root div and loading the main TypeScript entry point.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that sets up TanStack Router with routes for Dashboard, DataStructureVisualizer, GitConflictSimulator, IndustryChallengeFeed, ChallengeWorkspace, and MyNotes, all wrapped in a shared Layout.
frontend/src/components/AIMentorPanel.ts: Interactive AI Mentor chat panel that matches user queries against a keyword-based knowledge base to return structured mentor responses (approach, trade-offs, analogy, alternative) and persists them to the backend per session.
frontend/src/components/AlgorithmVisuali: Canvas-based algorithm visualizer component that renders animated step-by-step traversal for BST, flat array, hashmap, and linked list data structures, highlighting visited and current nodes/elements.
frontend/src/components/AnswerEditor.tsx: Simple styled textarea component styled as a code editor (with macOS-style traffic-light dots) for writing free-form markdown answers to challenges.
frontend/src/components/ChallengeCard.ts: Renders a clickable card for a coding challenge, displaying its category, difficulty badge, title, description preview, and estimated time derived from the challenge data.
Displays a side-by-side animated comparison of two data structures (BST, Array, HashMap, LinkedList), showing Big-O complexities, industry context tooltips, and step-through visualization driven by an interval timer.
frontend/src/components/DiffPanel.tsx: Renders a three-way diff view (BASE, OURS, THEIRS) with syntax-highlighted added/removed lines and line numbers in a side-by-side layout.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Provides the main app shell with a sticky header, desktop and mobile navigation, an AI Mentor panel toggle, and a persistent session ID stored in localStorage.
frontend/src/components/MentorResponseCa: Displays a structured AI mentor response broken into four labeled sections (Approach, Trade-offs, Real-world Analogy, Better Alternative), each with a distinct icon and color.
frontend/src/components/MergedOutputEdit: A simple textarea editor for resolving Git merge conflicts, prompting the user to remove conflict markers from the merged output.
frontend/src/components/ModuleCard.tsx: Renders a navigable card for a learning module, showing an icon, title, description, progress bar, and an animated SVG progress ring.
frontend/src/components/ProgressRing.tsx: An SVG circular progress indicator that animates from 0 to the given percentage on mount, supporting green, cyan, and purple color themes with a glow effect.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: A React hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor using the current Internet Identity, returning an anonymous actor when unauthenticated and invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication on the ICP platform, managing login state, identity persistence, and AuthClient creation with configurable options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching and mutating backend data, including getting all/single challenges, adding a challenge, and storing mentor responses via the actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that sets up a dark tech-themed design system using Tailwind CSS with OKLCH color tokens, neon accent utilities, custom component classes, and JetBrains Mono/Inter fonts.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider into the root DOM element.
frontend/src/pages/ChallengeWorkspace.ts: Page component for a single challenge workspace that loads a challenge by ID, displays its description and metadata, and provides an answer editor with local-storage persistence and submission handling.
frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx: Main dashboard page displaying a hero banner, stats row, and a grid of module cards linking to the app's four learning modules.
frontend/src/pages/DataStructureVisualiz: Interactive page that lets users select two data structures and run a side-by-side animated comparison using a fixed dataset, with play/reset controls and a completion state.
Interactive Git merge conflict simulator page with multiple predefined scenarios (variable rename, logic divergence, etc.), a split diff editor, merged output editor, hint system, and validation against expected resolutions.
frontend/src/pages/IndustryChallengeFeed: Page displaying a filterable/searchable feed of industry challenge cards (system design, algorithms, DevOps, etc.) fetched from the backend, with auto-seeding of default challenges if the backend is empty.
frontend/src/pages/MyNotes.tsx: Page that displays saved AI Mentor responses stored in localStorage, allowing users to expand, delete individual notes, or clear all notes for the current session.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining a dark-tech theme with neon color tokens (neon-green, neon-cyan, neon-purple), custom surface layers, JetBrains Mono font, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project state metadata describing the AI-powered CS education platform's architecture, existing features, known issues, and image asset requirements at schema version 1.0.0.
